ID02252-d-04-23-02-TPW.Narrative: TRAIN T-HLGI-22 ENGINES CEFX 9662-CEFX 9500, ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR ON DUTY 10:00 PM APRIL 22, 2002,WAS MOVING WEST WITH 26 LOADS, 5 EMPTIES, 4325 TONS.  AFTER THE LOCOMOTIVES AND HEAD 8 CARS OF THETRAIN PASSED OVER THE WEST END OF BRIDGE 53.67, AT MP 53.67E ON THE INDIANA SUBDIVISION, THE CAP ONTHE WEST BRIDGE PILING BEGAN TO FAIL.  THE WEST END OF BRIDGE BEGAN TO DROP SLOWLY, IMPARTING INCREASING VERTICAL MOTION TO THE CARS AS THEY PASSED OVER THE WEST END OF THE BRIDGE.  THERE WAS SUFFICIENT VERTICAL MOTION BETWEEN THE 19TH AND 20TH HEAD CARS TO SEPARATE BOTH THE COUPLER AND THE AIR HOSE, PUTTING THE TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY.  THE FORCE OF THE UNDESIRED EMERGENCY APPLICATION CAUSED THE ENDCAP TO FAIL COMPLETELY, DERAILING THE 22ND AND 23RD CARS IN THE TRAIN.  CAR DAMAGES AS FOLLOWS (ALLCARS LOADED COVERED HOPPERS OF CORN):  FURX 826814, NOKL 826181, NOKL 824717, NOKL 824438, NOKL 825590, NOKL 830922, NOKL 828933, NOKL 823553   CARS RERAILED BY HULCHER ON APRIL 24, 2002.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
